short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: A simple color picker for webpages. Pick and copy colors effortlessly. Supports HEX, RGB, HSL, CMYK.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
FEATURES
      • Pixel Color Picking: Capture colors from any pixel on a webpage.
      • Multiple Color Codes: Supports HEX, RGB, HSL, and CMYK codes.
      • Color History: Keeps a record of your picked colors.
      • Easy Copying: One-click copying of color codes.
      • Export/Download: Download your color list as a text file.
      • Delete Colors: Remove any color from your history.
      • Clear History: Clear your entire color history with one click.

BACKGROUND and PURPOSE
      • HueMore was born out of a personal need to pick colors from the web quickly, and also as a practice project. Uploading this one to share it with others who may find it useful.
      • I will maintain and improve HueMore in my free time, ensuring it continues to meet your color picking needs. Feel free to leave feedback or suggestions for the tool. Your support means the world to me - sending virtual hugs your way! 🤗

INSTALLATION and UNINSTALLATION
      • Installing HueMore is as simple as visiting the Chrome Web Store, searching for “HueMore - Color Picker”, and clicking on “Add to Chrome”. If you ever need to uninstall, just open the Extensions menu in Chrome, find HueMore, and click “Remove”.

TROUBLESHOOTING and SUPPORT
      • If you’re experiencing issues with HueMore, you can try reloading the web page, restarting the browser, checking for updates, or toggling the extension. If you’re still having trouble, please comment your issue in the feedback section on the extension’s page in the Chrome Web Store.

SECURITY and PRIVACY MEASURES
      • HueMore does not access, collect, or modify any information on any site you visit. It operates under manifest version 3, which only grants storage permissions. This is solely used for storing the list of colors that users have collected.

IMPORTANT NOTES
      • The color list on the right side of the extension is sorted by the latest picked colors. If you pick a pixel and its color is already in the list, it won’t be added again to avoid duplication. However, it will still be selected, and its corresponding color code will be displayed.
      • Please note that HueMore was developed and tested using the latest version of the Chrome browser. Compatibility with older versions has not yet been verified. The tool utilizes the EyeDropper API, which is currently classified as an “experimental technology”.
